oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Agreement between Wainwright and Cornelius for the construction of approximately 2,000 headboards for graves at a cost of $0.75 each. Stipulates where headboards are to be delivered, their appropriate dimensions, and specifications for inscriptions. Includes five-cent Internal Revenue Stamp affixed in the left margin.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Quartermaster of the Army provides logistical support to the combat troops in the form of ammunition, clothing, food, and pay. In 1862, the Quartermaster Department also assumed responsibility for burial of war dead and care of national cemeteries; W. R. Cornelius of Nashville had the contract for burying the Confederate dead in and around Nashville, and he buried about 3,000. He went on to secure the Federal contract and had branch houses at Murfreesboro and Chattanooga, Tennessee, and Huntsville, Alabama. In all, he buried about 40,000 soldiers.
